instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: I had a return cross my bench.  The original repair was R7121 and R7122 on U7100 were out of spec.  " not close to 10 ohms ".  Well it's back and they are bad once more.   I assume I have to replace U7100 but wanted feed back from others out there.  I don't understand how U7100 could fail like this.  The original repair lasted for three weeks before failing again.  I have measured both of these lines to ground and resistance is infinite.

threads.title: 820-00165 (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
820-00165 (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: In the future should I change U7100 when I discover failure on R7121 and R7122 just to be safe?

threads.title: 820-00165 (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: Apart of both caps, only U7100 can cause problems there...

threads.title: 820-00165 (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: I always replace the ISL if the sense resistors are blown

threads.title: 820-00165 (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: ok. I will start replacing the ISL. They are not that expensive.  LOL I could get some big honking resistors and put them on there.   Blow that MacBook .
